name: Overview
body:
## Research
I am a computer science PhD student at the University of Twente working under the supervision of [Andreas Peter](http://wwwhome.ewi.utwente.nl/~petera/). I am broadly interested in several aspects of security and privacy, such as applied cryptography, distributed systems security, network security and machine learning. I am currently particularly interested to the security and privacy challenges related to data leakage/exfiltration.

## Publications
Riccardo Bortolameotti, Andreas Peter, Marten H. Everts, Willem Jonker, Pieter Hartel. "Reliably Determining Data Leakage in the Presence of Strong Attackers" In Proceedings of the Annual Computer Security Applications Conference (ACSAC), Los Angeles, Dec 2016.

Riccardo Bortolameotti, Andreas Peter, Marten H. Everts, Damiano Bolzoni. "Indicators of Malicious SSL Connections" In Proceedings of the 9th International Conference Network and System Security (NSS), New York, Nov 2015.

## Teaching
- Teaching Assistant - Operating Systems (TOM-2.1-CS), ARM Exploitation Lab, Oct 2016.

## Education
- PhD @ University of Twente (2014 - present)
- Master degree Computer Science @ University of Trento and University of Twente (2012-2014), under the program [EIT Digital] (http://www.eitdigital.eu/eit-digital-academy/master-school/) with a major in Security and Privacy.
- Bachelor degree Computer Science @ University of Trento (2009-2012)
